intro: Erigeron lonchophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Erigeron lonchophyllus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
